title: Remove Nav Detail Summaries
goal: Strip the nav detail summary/CTA sections so tiles route directly via the main buttons.
environment: HTML + Vanilla JavaScript + Firebase + Jest + jsdom

specs.title: NavDetailSectionsRemoved
specs.given: An admin signs in and the icon nav renders.
specs.then: No `#navDetail-*` sections or `adminNavDetails` wrapper exist, ensuring the summaries/CTAs were removed.

specs.title: NavButtonsRouteWithoutCTAs
specs.given: The nav tiles render without auxiliary CTAs.
specs.when: A user clicks a tile such as Bundles.
specs.then: The app routes immediately via the button; no hidden `.admin-nav__cta` nodes remain for that section.

specs.title: NoDetailLayoutArtifacts
specs.given: The navigation markup has been simplified.
specs.then: Those nodes are absent so the layout no longer preserves empty wrappers.

changeNotes: Added specs to ensure nav detail summaries/CTAs are removed and only primary buttons remain after the cleanup.
admin.html + harness now render just the nav buttons (no adminNavDetails wrapper) with aria-controls pointing to real panels.
scripts/admin/main.js no longer wires CTA listeners and clears ?section aliases while routing via the primary buttons.

summary.details: Full Jest suite (including the new F15-TP4 removal specs) is green after stripping nav detail wrappers/CTAs.
